This gives the solution <block-math/><check><on-true>This can still be simplified into <block-math/></on-true><on-false>This cannot be simplified further.</on-false></check></on-true><on-false>Coincidentally the factor before the <inline-math/> has already dropped out. As a result, we have already found the solution, <block-math/></on-false></check></par><par>The last thing to do is to check the solution. practice.oneSolution.step4.problem.oldText: Based on the value of the contents of the square root, determine how many solutions the given equation has.

practice.oneSolution.step4.solution.oldText: <par>When the square root reduces to zero, the plus/minus in the solution vanishes and the equation will have exactly one solution.</par>

meta.learningGoals.oldText: <par>In this skill you learn to <term>calculate a sum of products</term>. You will for instance be asked to calculated <inline-math/> as the number <inline-math/>. Important here is to determine the order of operations, and then execute the operations in this specific order. Operations include addition, subtraction and multiplication. This skill does not involve fractions, powers and functions.</par>
